testInfo.title: Knowledge Test - Talent Management
testInfo.description: Test your knowledge about talent assessment, 9-box grid and employee categories

questions.text: What is 'Performance' in talent assessment context?

answers.text: Current results and effectiveness in achieving role objectives
Employee's ability to develop and advance in the future
Employee motivation and engagement in company activities
Work tenure and professional experience

questions.explanation: Performance is about current results - how effectively an employee achieves their role objectives.

questions.text: What is 'Potential' in talent assessment context?

answers.text: Ability to grow and take on greater responsibility in the future
Current effectiveness in task completion
Number of completed training courses
Level of satisfaction with current role

questions.explanation: Potential is the ability and readiness to take on greater responsibility and grow into more complex roles.

questions.text: An employee with high Performance and high Potential is:

answers.text: Star (Q9) - top development priority
Key Player (Q6) - experienced expert
Rising Talent (Q8) - still needs experience
Stable Performer (Q5) - solid contributor

questions.explanation: Q9 (Star) are employees in top-right corner of 9-box - high Performance + high Potential. They're the top development priority.

questions.text: An employee with high Performance but low Potential is:

answers.text: Expert (Q7) - valuable specialist in their field
Star (Q9) - fast-track promotion candidate
Key employee (Q5) - average performer
Poor performer (Q1) - requires corrective action

questions.explanation: Q7 (Expert) are valuable specialists with high Performance but low Potential - they excel at their work but don't seek greater responsibility.

questions.text: An employee with low Performance but high Potential is:

answers.text: Enigma (Q3) - requires analysis of poor results causes
Star (Q9) - development priority
Key employee (Q5) - solid performer
Poor performer (Q1) - termination candidate

questions.explanation: Q3 (Enigma) is when we see potential but results are poor. Need to understand why - role fit, onboarding, obstacles.

questions.text: An employee achieves 100% of their goals but never takes initiative beyond their scope. Where would you place them?

answers.text: High Performance, low Potential (Q7 - Expert)
High Performance, high Potential (Q9 - Star)
Medium Performance, medium Potential (Q5 - Key employee)
Low Performance, high Potential (Q3 - Enigma)

questions.explanation: Lack of initiative and drive to expand scope signals low potential. Performance is high, but lacks development ambition - that's Q7 Expert.

questions.text: A new employee shows fast learning pace, proposes improvements and helps others. Results are average (60% of goals) as they've only been with company 3 months. Where would you place them?

answers.text: Medium Performance, high Potential (Q6 - Future Star)
Low Performance, high Potential (Q3 - Enigma)
High Performance, high Potential (Q9 - Star)
Medium Performance, medium Potential (Q5 - Key employee)

questions.explanation: Short tenure + high potential signals (learning, proactivity) + growing results = Q6 Future Star. Too early for Q9 Star, but potential is visible.

questions.text: Which of the following is the STRONGEST indicator of high Potential?

answers.text: Voluntarily takes on more challenging tasks and responsibility beyond their role
Has long tenure with company (5+ years)
Is well-liked by the team
Completed many professional trainings

questions.explanation: Best indicator of potential is BEHAVIOR - voluntarily expanding scope and taking on responsibility. It shows ambition and readiness.

questions.text: A manager rates all their employees as 'above expectations' because 'they don't want to demotivate them'. What is this?

answers.text: Leniency bias - tendency to inflate ratings
Halo effect - rating based on one trait
Recency bias - focusing on recent events
Correct approach - motivation is most important

questions.explanation: Leniency bias is the tendency toward leniency and rating inflation. It destroys credibility of assessment system and prevents development.

questions.text: What should you do with an employee with high Performance but low Potential (Q7 - Expert)?

answers.text: Keep in expert role, appreciate expertise, don't force managerial promotion
Immediately promote to managerial position as reward for results
Place on reduction list, as they lack potential
Force them to take greater responsibility to develop potential

questions.explanation: Q7 (Expert) are valuable resources - technical experts, specialists. Should appreciate them in their role, not force managerial path.
